author: Kristin Tice Studeman
title: Diary of a Teenage Girl Premiere, Alexander Skarsgard - Party Photos, Prabal Gurung, Seth Meyers, Tali Lennox
text:
8 View the slideshow
Bel Powley, Margarita Levieva, and Alexander Skarsgard
Photo: Jamie McCarthy / Getty Images
A few days ago, Alexander Skarsgard showed up to the San Francisco screening of his latest flick, The Diary of a Teenage Girl , in full drag. “I went with some of my dear friends who are drag queens and I didn’t want to be excluded in a stupid suit,” the actor explained at last night’s Sony Pictures Classics and The Cinema Society-presented screening of the film at New York’s Landmark Sunshine Cinema. For the record, he opted for a more minimal look on Wednesday, sporting a “boring” suit for the occasion. Of his first drag experience, he said, “Emotionally it was amazing, but physically it was very painful. I couldn’t walk, I couldn’t do anything, and I felt like Edward Scissorhands. Oh, baby, don’t mess with a drag queen.”
In the film by writer and director Marielle Heller, which is set in 1970s San Francisco, Skarsgard stars as the boyfriend to Kristen Wiig’s character, Charlotte, and sex partner to her precocious 15-year-old daughter, Minnie, played by up-and-comer Bel Powley.
“Me, Alex, and Mari [Heller] would just, like, chill out in our robes on the bed in between the sex scenes, making jokes together,” Powley told Style.com. “We were totally comfortable.” As for her clothed scenes, Powley (who wore a Miu Miu frock and heels last night) said, “It was lots of high-waisted flare jeans and little stripe-y T-shirts and clogs—I loved it!” She added, “The only thing I wasn’t so keen on were those bangs. They were so thick and it took, like, a year to grow them out.” The 23-year-old Brit is already off to shoot her next film , A Storm in the Stars , with Elle Fanning.
